I'm not a senior but my grandmother was beaten by her mother and of course in school. She also had to do all the chores and help on the farm. During the naziperiod a lot of her elders were nazis and very racist. They also shamed her for her non-german looks. My mother told me that. But my grandmother is a very modern woman for her time: she divorced my grandfather, raised my mother on her own and went with her friends to gay bars, when they came up in germany. WRITING.TITLE: Feeding snakes as a ratmum
WRITING.TEXT: So i just got the snakes from my brother due to problems in his living situation. We always help each other especially, when it's for the sake of our animals and it was clear, that i'll take them, if something unexpected happens, because we want to make sure, that all of our animals are fine. But as you may know, snakes are fed with rats and mice. I also have rats (of course they aren't in danger and are kept in a seperate room). So i don't know how to feel about this situation and how to handle it. Of course i know, that i have to feed the snakes at one point or another and they have the right to be fed, as any other of my animals and that they have this in their nature. My problems are my emotions. Is there somebody who was in this situation before? How would you handle that. Please keep in mind, that i'm a very emotional person, who loves all their animals, so comments like "just give them away" won't help. I need some serious advice

Okay. We have a very nice person, from whom we get the mice and rats, who knows a lot about snakes. He breeds the mice and rats himself and puts them to sleep as well. We have 4 snakes. Two corn snakes (i don't know, if it's the correct english term), where i don't know the exact age but they are adults and 2 boa c.i, whom are not even a year. I am absolute new with snakes and have a lot to learn because it was very spontanious but i usually inform myself before i get a new pet, which i couldn't do much this time. I usually have mamals as pets. But thank you for the advice. I'll try to stay calm

I am in good contact with a specialist, who educated my brother before and from whom we get the feeding animals (we can get some frozen and alive). I know when to feed them but it's just the emotional part.

Tbh i think it's give and get. Trink our beer and eat our bread and don't think twice about it. If you enjoy that part of german culture it's enough appreciation. And that's how i think about every culture-related thing. Eat each others food with respect, wear each others clothes with respect and treat each other with respect
Clothes, for me, aren't a romantic present except lingerie.
Reminds me of my rat banana. She is huge for her age. Still a nice floofball

She seemed like the perfect human when i was a child but then i realised, that she is just a weak person, who likes to be seen as a victim. Had a rough time accepting that and my mother had even a harder time breaking free from this devil's circle

That's totally normal. You see: my rats just slept so this kind of mucus wasn't groomed away. You can find it around the eyes and nose. They usually groom it away but sometimes it sits there for a while.

How old is your rat? Older rats can have a difficult time while grooming. But some rats are just lazy. Please check, if it's just mucus and not blood/pus or if the eye is swollen to keep your rats healthy.

Okay. Are they your first rats? Then I would recommend you doing some research on rats to be sure they stay healthy. They seem easy to keep but there are actually a lot of things you have to do. Ratguru is an awesome channel on YouTube to learn everything important

WRITING.TITLE: I hate how people don't care about animals especially in internetvideos
WRITING.TEXT: So i've seen a lot of animalvideos recently, where an animal is harmed. From the outside it seems cute but if you are informed properly, you know that they are in distress and as soon as someone points that out everybody is like: "Let people enjoy things! It's cute okay?!" Examples are: Rodens put into water or washed with soap or small animals like hamsters on a leash. And of course giving dangerous food, which humans can eat but are bad for those animals. It's okay if your first think, that it's cute and that the animal seems to enjoy it but why defend and support something after being told, that the situation is bad and harmful for the animal?

For everyone who needs to cool their rats spontaneously: put a plate or tile in the fridge, wait until it has a good temperature (not to warm or to cold) than place it in the cage. It's perfect because your rat's can't get frostbite from ice or chew trough it, which makes it reusable. Or let them fish for food in a tub with belly high water, don't put too much water in it, that could lead to health problems. Anyways this idea is amazing.

WRITING.TITLE: How do you cope with being rejected by your father (as a female)?
WRITING.TEXT: My father left me as a very young girl and rejected me many times after that. Now I'm having the consequences as a young woman and I almost killed myself while battling depression and anxiety. I am currently experiencing a relapse and I just realised that I never met a woman or a person in general who got out of it and only people who have died because of it. Female advise would be very appreciated (because being rejected by the own father can have different affects depending on the sex) but feel free to comment anyways!
Your answer was very fast. Most of the time I'm not sure if anyone reads my posts but I'm glad I've already got a response. Thank you, everything helps at the moment.

You can tell her that she should and can get help and that you would support her. Don't pressure her. Say what ways there are to get better and tell her that she can talk to you. Go to a hospital and get it checked (infections can get dangerous and some of the cuts might have to be glued with some gluestrips). Search for some number you can call if she cuts herself too deep by accident and try to get professional advice. Stay calm! If you get nervous it won't help and could make the situation worse. Tell her she doesn't have to be afraid or ashamed. And if she cuts herself you may need at least some disinfectant or sterile natriumchloride (to wash out dirt from the wounds) for cleaing wounds and surfaces. The truth is: there is a high chance this will go on for a while so she should at least get the chance to do it as safely as possible. But remember: if you think she got worse, call an ambulance. It's not your responsibility and there are professionals out there

Some theories: Homosexuality has some benefits for society. For example: Homosexuals often raise children who don't have parents or parents who can't take care. That could mean that homosexual people took care of the family and children in the past because they weren't occupied with raising their own children, which means the whole family had a better chance of survival. Humans survived because we are social creatures and homosexuals could have helped with that. Studies also showed that homosexual men have a higher emotional intelligence than heterosexual men, which means they could act as social support for the group. Natural doesn't always mean reproduce but surviving and homosexuals could have helped with that and still do. There is a tedtalk that covers this topic and theories.

It's normal to have a phase where you question your sexuality. That doesn't mean you are gay. You say that you are attracted to girls so it's clear that you are not gay. It depends on the animals natural eating habits. Horses, for example, eat mostly weeds and are used to having a monotone diet. Dogs eat different things (not only meat) so you should try to mix it up from time to time. Cats eat small rodents like mice a lot so they should get something that resembles it like wet food with fitting nutrients (dry food can be dehydrating and not very healthy because they normally eat meat, not grain! Be careful) and don't need a big variety. I think there is a big problem with racism on every side. Everyone against everyone. There where the offenders and the damage is obvious but I also think a big part of the problem is that minorities (not all of course!!!) often don't want to leave their roles as victims behind. You can see it with the n-word. It is a rude word, everybody knows that but to forbid if in every context is dumb. If I read a book out loud with the n-word I didn't meant to offend anyone, I'm reading a book. I am a woman but I don't tell you to stop saying bitch or whore even though woman were and are (for example India and africa) an oppressed and abused part of society. But the n-word is also more of an American thing. Also very funny when some unfriendly African American complains about white people even though americans and europeans, for example, have totally different cultures and europeans within have different cultures. It's totally ridiculous to put everybody in the same place. That's how racism is made. People in general need to befriend each other, meet each other and help each other. WRITING.TITLE: I thought I would kill myself after breaking up with my boyfriend
WRITING.TEXT: We were together for 2 1/2 years and he was/is a wonderful person and I always thought I would be too weak to go through breaking up with him. There were a lot if things that came together that lead me into ending our relationship. I don't hate him, he did nothing wrong but I guess he hasn't matured a lot in the last few years unlike me and things started to get difficult. But he was always there for me and sadly I also became dependent on him. I thought I would never be alone again with him by my side. I decided I don't want this in a relationship and just do it even when I have to suffer. And I did it. And I don't feel sad. I don't know if those feelings will arrive some day. I don't know if I will suffer but right now I'm okay. I really am. And I enjoy the attention of other potential partners. I enjoy that other people think I'm attractive and nice. I'll always love him, he is great but I think i made the right decision. And I'm glad depression didn't take over my life because of that. I think I am a grown-up now.

WRITING.TITLE: My rat saved me from my horrible dream
WRITING.TEXT: When I have a hard time with depression I get really bad dreams. Last Saturday I had one of them. Short description: I was in a "game" and the only thing it did was to make you panic until you realise it's a game but nobody tells you that so you struggle for eternity if you are unlucky. So I was trapped in this dream and then I woke up because my rat blue, who always gets out of her cage at night somehow, was eating my roasted sunflower seeds I left at my bed. Every time she gets out of the cage she climbes into my bed and wakes me up to cuddle. This time it saved me from my dream. I can't describe how terrifying it was, the feeling that I was trapped in this panic for what feels like eternity. Waking up to her was the best thing that could have happened at that moment. And she'll never know what she did for me that night.
Very true. They keep you going and reward you with tons of love

You shouldn't bathe rats. If they are dirty you should put some peas or cooked noodles into a flat plastic box and fill it only until their bellies are covered. Or put some coconut oil on them. They clean themselves most of the time. Also don't let them become cold they are prone to infections.

Even though it's cute please be reminded that you shouldn't bathe a rat until it's really necessary. That's because they are prone to infections and have sensitive lungs. They also clean themselves actually. The best way to clean a rat is to put on some coconut oil and let them lick it off their fur, cleaning themselves in the process or putting belly high water in a tub with peas and cooked noodles to fish for. Rats are amazing but their lungs are often very fragile.

Was asked to mention this here: Rats clean themselves. You shouldn't bathe them exept if it's really necessary. They have fragile lungs and are prone to lunginfections. You can clean them by putting belly high water in a plastic container and put some cooked peas and noodles in to fish for. You can also put coconut oil on the fur. They will clean themselves while licking it off. You can also use a damp,soft cloth if something is really sticky. Old rats are usually cleaned by the other group members. If they are very smelly you should consider changing your cage cleaning routine and be sure that they are healthy. Rats are amazing and sweet but due to our breeding they have a high chance of getting respiratory disease.
I did. And thanks for showing me this sub I didn't know something like that existed. Proper animal care is always important for me

Cats like all animals have a smell. It's natural. The bad smell is often caused by the toilets if they aren't cleaned regularly. You don't need to bathe or clean them if they are healthy. Only if they have a dirty behind or illness which causes them to have puss or blood or other illness related fluids on them. Still, animals smell like animals and you shouldn't change that because you can't deal with it.
The problem with baths is that petrats are prone to infections and that's why they should be kept dry.
For some it might be irritating but for most it's just a snack stuck in their fur.

WRITING.TITLE: Rope safety
WRITING.TEXT: I am pretty new with rope play and I have a big question regarding safety. I am always very careful and don't want the rope to be too tight, always checking with two fingers and looking if the skin is getting blue. I heard that if it turns blue you should undo it but I often see blue skin, very tight ropes and stuff like that here on Reddit and elsewhere and there are no comments asking if it is safe or saying that it isn't safe. It confuses me because I don't know if those ropes only look tight or if mine are just very loose... I just want to be careful and follow the safety advice from people with lots of experience.
Thank you for this answer. It was really, really helpful and I'm feeling much more confident that what I was doing wasn't that bad.

You already received some good advice here but I just want to throw in that it can be absolutely normal to smell down there after a day or exercise. Keep in mind that there is sweat and moisture that builds up and that vaginas just smell a bit in general. Just like your armpits it gets smelly after a while, you clean yourself and that's it (if you are healthy). And if you are very conscious about it you might notice it even more. So it's very important to talk to a doctor and if everything is okay, it's just your body and that's totally normal and fine. Don't think that everybody smells nice down there after a day of school or work. We all are smelly animals in the end of the day.

I can see your point but I think that in the USA especially, racism is often addressed as a problem between black and white people. Racism goes a lot further. As a European I see a lot of racism against other white people, from white people, which is based on which country you come from. I also think that "white people" is too generalised just like "black people" in the USA. People can have a light skin colour but still experience racism due to the fact that they are from a different country or have a different culture. Same goes with dark skin. People can also have a light skin colour and be mixed and experience racism. Racism is not exclusive to the black community in the USA or to dark skin. Every community needs to work on it's racist behaviours and thoughts and acknowledge them. But that doesn't mean they shouldn't fight to be treated without racism, more specifically, they SHOULD and I stand with them because you can't make a change while saying everyone is bad so they shouldn't say anything against it. Fight for your rights while working on giving others their rights!

Let them stare at you. Especially with Karens as parents because then there will be less chances for the kids to see and look at non-binary people and be interested because the contact with people who are different will be very limited. Don't think about the Karen, think about the kid and the representation

Kids stare because they are interested. It's really us adults who consider it unfriendly but from the perspective of a child this is the only time they can observe a person who maybe is different from what the kid is used to. And children need the chance to look at new things and people. Even better when they have a chance to talk. A lot of children stare at me and I've never once talked to one that was unfriendly while asking me about my piercings, tattoos and self harm scars. People forget that it's special for them to see different people because you might be the first or second person who is androgynous or has piercings or is very tall or has a differnt skin colour that the child has ever seen! We should use those chances and make it into a good experience so the child feels positive about different people.

Oh man are you me? These kind of situations grew into a full blown anxiety disorder for me. I almost killed myself because of it. I took my finals this year and my therapist helped me to get into a room where i was alone and they checked on me every few minutes. When i am nervous it's much worse and sitting is also very difficult for me. So from the bottom of my heart: Go to a therapist and talk to you uni/college. Talk about it and ask what your options are. Maybe you have a good friend there that will be your moral support when you go. That helped me. I am still not over it but i have a great support system and that helps to handle it better.

Thank you, I am better now (just graduated so no painful schooltime). I feel better when i tell people about it and they reassure me that they have empathie for my situation but that's my way to deal with it. My teachers were very understanding and they kept the information from the rest of the class. And my therapist helps me with talking about the embarrassment i feel and i had a special paper, where i could go home if i needed to and that was also a big helper and a form of support. Try to check your options, so that you can be in a comfortable situation in the long run. I wish you all the best and also hope that there will be more online class options when i start with college this year. If you ever feel the need to talkt to someone about this specific problem, just write a message.
Your facial features, especially your eyeshape, look really great and defined
I also assume that OP meant a trans person, which would make it transphobic but the person could also meant be a cross dresser or a drag queen, who consider themselves male.

Guys, u should also check the area from your nipples to your armpits!!! I can't stress this enough. People think breastcancer is only around the nipple but look at a tutorial and see where you have to check yourself and with which handmovements. It's a much wider area than you might expect.

Not a movie but Jojo's bizarre adventure. I love that anime but damn, it would be much shorter if they would talk to each other from time to time or think a little bit. Some of them are even written as intelligent characters but wouldn't see the difference betweet their friend or a stranger with the same haircolour.

WRITING.TITLE: YSK (TRIGGER WARNING) a lot of pregnancies end in a miscarriages and it has nothing to do with the pregnant person's health
WRITING.TEXT: Why YSK: It happens and it happens a lot (1 in 8 pregnancies, source: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/Miscarriage/), especially in the first three months. But it's still a traumatic experience for most of the parents and a lot of the people, who had the physical miscarriage, feel gulity about it. You can help actively with braking the taboo around the topic trough talking and seeking help for the ones affected, if needed. And if you need help dealing with this emotional trauma, you should reach out to professionals (doctors, therapists) and people you trust.

Your feelings are valid and I hope you'll find a way to find peace with it somehow. I think i know what you want to say and I'm glad that you are sharing your expericence. That is very brave and might inspire others to open up about it too. I'm sending you lots of love

Yes, that's how it was explained to me too. I think it's good that people have the choice to not tell anyone but on the other hand a lot of them will suffer alone because of it. Everyone should look for themselves and see what's comfortable. I just hope that there will be more love and an opend mind from others when the people decide to talk about it so they don't feel forced to keep it to themselves.
Can someone explain what HRT is and what it does, please?
Me, speaking average English, learned in school: "I don't get it:(" Op: *explaines jokes in title* Me: "Very funny :)" (edit) *feels included*
Maybe there is a project in your area where you can spend time with children. Stuff like a big brother project.
Alright, thank you!
I always strat to cry when thinking about that my mum is goung to die some day. What am I going to do without her and her hungs and cuddles?

That happens. They can get hooked on them. Don't worry about it too much. You should try to pull off like a hoop from a stick or something. Idk how to explain but sometimes you can't just rip them off.

There is this gambling place on my way to the city and tge guys use my dog as a way to talk to me. They are so stubborn. I can literally say: "I'm not interested" and they keep on going. They just want to be friends yadayada. I don't kneed a 45 yo gambler as my friend. Fuck them

Not birthday but Christmas: A weight watchers best of minced meat book by my mother's step sister. She knew i am a vegetarian, she knew i struggled with my weight gain because of depression and hard medication, she knew i had an ed.
500 terabytes of child porn was found. 500 terabyte...
The ending of lady gaga's Alejandro. Have a hard time watching it in the dark, still.
Looks like a Doberman but with cut ears.
Yeah, I think you are right. I didn't think about the fact that they cut their ears too.
As much as I know that's not true. Scishow did a Video about it and I think they said that dolphins don't geh high from the fish.
I also gained a lot of weight from medications i had to take due to depression. As if that isn't hard enough.
Not so fun fun fact: I use cigs to go to the toilet because nothing else works in the morning
Something that works good in some situations: Do you think your mum is proud of you?

WRITING.TITLE: TW: Teacher discriminates against my friend
WRITING.TEXT: I'm a little bit heart broken right now. My friend is on his identity journey and just told his class his new name and new pronouns. But there is this one teacher we all actually loved and he doesn't accept it and gets very bitter when the class calls him out on it. But the principal says: As long as *female name* is on the paper, you can call them *female name*. We are all very shocked and sad and don't know what to do. My friend was so brave with telling everyone and this reaction from the teacher is so painful and disappointing. What can I do to support my friend and what can the class do support his rights? We don't want to just watch this crap going on.

WRITING.TITLE: When are you mixed-race?
WRITING.TEXT: So my grandpa is a black american, my father is mixed my mother is german with a roma amp;sinthi heritage but mainly german. I have light olive skin with African and midlle-european features. People often think I'm from arab countries or India. Sometimes i don't know how i should identify myself. I don't "feel" german but I'm nothing else either. I feel inbetween sometimes, like I belong nowhere. Am I mixed too or are people only mixed, if the parents are from different races? For example like my father.

Yeah I thought about that too, especially since my family is really broken so there are not a lot of stories from my ancestors. But I was always very excited about this topic, so i should look into it.
So is this like from one cell or? It confuses me when I see stuff like that in reality
everybody knew what they wanted to be when they grow up and now all of my friends are like: I'll just study something idk

I think there are a lot of bad things: Other cruel kids, The very narrow spectrum of things where you can show your talents, making or breaking your school career and impacting your academic future, Depressed and frustrated teachers and a horrrible lack of funding in most countries. So i don't wonder when students lose interest.
Had it until I got bulimia. Did a full 180 and now I can throw up whenever I want. I recovered from the bulimia btw so I don't abuse my power.
Kids from 2000. It's may feel like we are 10 but we are allowed to have sex, drive cars and to drink (in most countries).

WRITING.TITLE: Most parents are not mature enough to raise a child without mentally damaging it.

WRITING.TEXT: I think one important thing is that we grow up and realise why our parents reacted the way they did and that brings a lot of healing... or not, depending on how shitty they were
Yeah, but most can live with it.
I would excuse myself but English isn't my native language and it's confusing sometimes so i don't care and no child was hurt by it.

I don't think so. I mean parents hurt their children physically by accident. The zipper caught the skin, you stepped on their toe... And to be a person who never lashes out or has so much control that they handle situations well is extremly hard. But I think a big problem is that a lot of them don't even try. Love is the most important thing because it's easier to live with a toe that hurts when mum gives you kisses and says sorry.
My mum started breaking the cycle. I'm very proud of her and I'll try my best to use this new and better situation that she made for me.
You really honour your name
I think it just happens tbh even if you are a very good parent. But most importantly is how it impacts the child long term. Most of them are fine in the long run, I hope.
I think so too.
I think when people feel ready. When they have the energy to give the love and time, why not with 25? I think both, being young or older, has it's benefits.
That sounds exhausting and I really mean it. I hope you'll find a good way to deal with it until you are in a place where you can say: Alright if that's life then that's fine.
u/subject5305
True. Those comments really make me think more detailed about this whole process of raising a child.

Sometimes I really wonder if people have children so they can abuse them. It's frightening how many are fine with abusive behaviour. And it's heartbreaking that the only thing you can do sometimes is to sit and watch.

That's true. I think a lot of parents feel left alone. And I think there needs to be more education for them. But I think western society, in general, isn't really kidfriendly. We think we know a lot but in the end there really aren't a lot of tools that are given to parents, in my opinion.

I think it's normal. Everyone has a scar or two. But the fact that it's the norm makes it weird for me. It's the norm that most parents make major mistakes while raising their child and it's normal. And with the suicide rates: I think mental health doesn't really have a place in society yet. We are getting there slowly but, with our lifestyle and how most of us are missing a community with enough security social wise, I think it's a long way to go. And it's a big taboo in a lot of families when someone they know is mentally ill. It's this thing that can happen to everyone, except for you and your family. Like a car accident. It only happens to everyone else and that's acceptable. But when you or your daughter are the one that have the problem, it's much harder to speak out. Because: why me? It's a difficult topic and I can talk a lot about it, if I want to but I'll stop here.
20 years isn't a lot, ok? :'( And I can't rember 3 of them. I'm just trying to figure stuff out for myself as best as I can

Some kids are just weird tho. If it worries you just tell them. Could be that he just needs some time, maybe a light form of autism, which is also fine or ADHD. Testing could be good if it's something that could make the child's life harder in the long run.
I actually chuckled while reading this lol
I do want to give the chance that people can say "maybe yours but not my parents"
I think a lot of people feel the same. I have to hype myself up for everyday stuff all the time.
I hope that at some point we will give them more time to mature properly. Everything is so fast and kids need time.

If you think so, I would recommend talking about it. They need a chance to adapt to it. He deserves the best chance he can get and there are more possibilities now than 10 years ago. I've been in a home for mentally ill kids and a lot of them had so much potential but they just stamped them off as disabled after being diagnosed with autism and one of them couldn't even tie his shoes when he came to us because nobody taught him. He is capable of everything normal and is living his best life now but you really have to look out for them so they don't fall trough the system. I wish the best of luck for you, the kid and the parents. It's nice how how you care about them.
I think that's a good decision and I'm happy for you that you know it's the right one.

My mum always says: Children are great as long as I can give them back to their parents. (Me and my sibling was more than enough for her) And I can really understand you. It's is a big difference. With them you can spend quality time but raising children isn't just quality time.

I'm aware of my childhood but I'm not really projecting. I mean sure, maybe you are lucky but if you read the other comments, a lot of people feel the same. And I rarely meet someone who doesn't have a mental problem because of their parents. Some are minor, some are major. But you can have your opinion and I don't mind. It's just a showerthought.
You are doing your best and I think he knows but now I'll keep my account for the next 20 years.
I was working out tbh but don't tell anyone.
Maturity is weird. In 5th grade I thought 10th graders were mature. In 1st grade I thought 4th graders were mature. Now I'm 20 and nobody seems really mature.

My therapist said to me once: Being afraid of something that you might do is the best thing that prevents you from doing it because you are aware that it can happen. Trying is the best you can do anyways.
More power to you. I think it's great how responsible people have become with the choice of (not) having children.

For all you who comment "It'S ThEm not iT": Yes, I know, thank you oh holy native speakers for calling out my mistake! And for everyone else: Thank you guys. You gave me a lot to think about tonight. I think a lot of you try your best and I love that. We aren't perfect but most of us understand that and I hope that all of you parents (will) have amazing relationships with your amazing children. And if you choose not to have them: That's great and it's amazing how reflecting alot of you are. My heart also goes out to the ones who had/have very bad parents. It's hard and exhausting and I just hope that all of you find a way to make peace with it. You all deserve being happy.
But you are already aware. Your intelligence tricked you!
I think a lot of them aren't really aware. So they can't even try and some of them simply don't want to because it's hard.

That's hard. I hope that your parent's will stop pressuring you. You know what's best for you and nobody should feel like they have the right to tell you otherwise. I think a lot of people have children because it's "normal" and part of life and not because they really want them.
I can't hug you but at least I can tell you that you are important and that comments like yours make my day with being relatable and funny.

I am perfectly fine. It came to my mind after being on r/insaneparents and how many lovely children were treated as pieces of trash and how many of my friends (myself too but I'm okay with it now) had similar experiences.
I'll always be my mum's little baby but she knows when I have to go my own way. But I know parents who have a hard time letting their children grow up and in the end everybody is frustrated.
A dog is already a big responsibility and most people can't handle that. Edit: Which is fine but they shouldn't get a dog... or child.
That's amazing!
I am fine (hope you too). But I'm looking into a lot of r/insaneparents and documentaries about childhood lately.
YES!

It's easier to hold a grudge against someone than to work on relationships. I hope they'll find together. As a child of a singlemum, who was the breadwinner, I can understand her but at some point I needed to see the perspective of my mother and why she did what she did. And now I know that she did the best that she could do for me.
I'm sorry. I hope they found or will find strength and a place in the LGBTQ+ community, if they want to. Do you support them?
The first pancake is always the worst
I think hating your parents or one of them is perfectly fine. And I think you have good reasons there. It's hard when they can't admit to making a mistake. False pride
True. Damage doesn't need to be devastating.

I thought so but wasn't sure. My friend came out as trans recently. We are trying our best to support him but there are a lot of "old-fashioned" people who make his coming out harder than it has to be so I see how hard your situation might be. I send you lots of love and strength. I am proud that you and I are LGBTQ+ people. It's nice to know that I belong to a group of amazing and kind people like you.
They are. I don't think we would have survived if not.

You don't have to believe anything but assuming it's a slap at my parents is really... weird? I explained in some comments why I had this thought. And yes I had a bad parent but this post came mostly from a point of observation.
